verbose_text: Odukoya et al. [XREF_BIBR] have shown that the alcohol and petrol extracts of seeds of Aframomum danielli (Zingiberaceae), used traditionally as a food spice and also as an anti-inflammatory agent, inhibit the soya 5-lipoxygenase enzyme and thus may show anti-inflammatory activity.
evidence: alcohol and petrol extracts of seeds of Aframomum danielli (Zingiberaceae), used traditionally as a food spice and also as an anti-inflammatory agent, inhibit the soya 5-lipoxygenase
